Review Text: Good restaurant & bar to chill with friends! I love the decors & set up! Good food & reasonable price! Definitely return!

Fantastic food and even better service. The staff was super attentive.
We had the chef’s menu. A good combination of Spanish classic tapas (particularly the iberico was top notch) with a couple of new asian inspired tapas.

Second time here, brought the kids along this time.
Thankful that it weren't crowded - so the kids were able to roam around a little.
The live band and singer helped spruce up the mood and our little ones loved it.
The pretty and glittery bar aside, the tapas that we ordered were all fun and different from most other restaurants, even other Spanish tapas restaurants, and that sense of intrigue at the arrival of each dish just made the entire dining experience more fun. The servers were also quick to help us at every turn and to explain each dish to us.
The restaurant also served us some free dessert for Vietnamese Women's Day.

Good experience overall. Well done.

Giá trị: 4
Dịch vụ: 4
Đồ ăn: 4
Không khí: 5
Review Title: Restaurant de Tapas rue du Docteur Calmette
Review Text:
Une belle conjugaison que ce restaurant de Tapas entre la France qui avait baptisé la rue, l'Espagne et sa cuisine et Ho Chi Minh Ville avec ses nombreuses tables. Il est accessible par un étroit escalier qui donne sur une grande et jolie salle bien climatisée et décorée aux couleurs de l'Espagne dominante rouge. Même la musique y est, présente mais discrète. L'ambiance est agréable, les serveurs souriants même s'ils ont besoin d'être sollicités. La carte est alléchante avec la plupart des assiettes en photos. C'est bien présenté, commenté par le serveur et les saveurs sont fines mais quelques unes sont vraiment minuscules, à l'image des calamars frits dont la portion minuscule ne vaut pas être partagée. Sa photo ne figure d'ailleurs pas sur la carte.
Pour le même prix nous aurions aimé un peu plus copieux.

Wonderful restaurant tucked away in district 1. 

We had a lovely meal with some of the best tapas dishes we’ve had. The food has a fine dining feel without being pretentious, as do the staff.

This restaurant is lovely and I’d recommend it to anyone who enjoys good food in a professional yet relaxed environment.

Review Text: Had some tapas and sangria was very good, had the mini burgers and fries. The sangria was lovely and the restaurant was lovely and clean and nicely decorated. Was a bit overpriced but worth it

Review Title: worst paella i have eaten in my life
Review Text: the worst paella I've ever eaten in my life , I visit Spain often , I have a Spanish chef friend I even sent him a picture of this paella he laughed that it's definitely not paella , you should either start serving real paella or stop selling what you call paella , the worst paella  I've eaten in my life, burnt rice, burnt taste!  service was nice and good . CHECK PHOTO OF PAELLA BEFORE YOU ORDER IT . 😂

What a lovely surprise this place was. A bit hidden away. After spending days walking around Saigon looking for good food, we found this place round the corner from the hotel. The staff were fantastic,  the food was very very good. The decor and ambiance was very laid back. This is  must if you visit Saigon.

Additional Ratings:
Giá trị: 5
Dịch vụ: 5
Đồ ăn: 5
Review Text:
「トマトのタコス」と「ワサビクリームとマグロの海苔巻き」と「イカ墨パエリア」をいただきました。どこもとってもおいしい。時間隊がずれていたせいか店はすいていたが夜はライブ演奏をやっているようなので、次回はライブを聞きに再訪したい。
サングリアもフルーツたっぷりで爽やかな甘さで、おいしい。
Extremely expensive for what you eat. Not on a gourmet level. The food it ok but not worth the money. 10$ for a glass of wine (tempranillo) is also extremely expensive

Review Title: Great Night for Vietnamese and Foreigners
Review Text: Great service, great vibe and the best Tapas in Vietnam.. Downtown Saigon, walking distance from all the highlights...
Very nice ambience with chic interior, lovely tapas menu and very friendly service. Reasonable compared to D1 neighbors!!

Review Title: Not a first time and never disappoints.
Review Text: Excellent Spanish Tapas in Saigon. Highly recommended for any occasion. Authentic flavor. El sabor de Sevilla en Saigon.

Pretty chill, open concept bar resto setting above Maison Marou choco. Most items are pretty authentic Spanish Tapas.

It was rare to find Angus beef tartar on a set lunch starters menu in HCMC but it's available here. Their "Pisto Manchego" was a simple, but probably unique twist of egg on toast with the addition of the Manchego (sheep) cheese.

Our mains of "Canelones" and "Tortilla abierta de morcilla y chorizo" were comforting and tasty, though they also felt like starters, as they had few slices of chorizo and sausage on an egg, kinda like half a portion of an American breakfast. Then again, quality VS quantity? You decide. The Catalan-style creme brulee was pretty normal. 

Would recommend this place for comforting Spanish Tapas flavours.
Lựa chọn không thể tuyệt vời hơn nếu muốn thưởng thức ẩm thực Tây Ban Nha. Từ phong cách, không khí, âm nhạc v.vv tất cả đều hài hoà. Món ăn cũng rất dễ chịu, phù hợp khẩu vị người Việt.

Review Title: How to make a customer feel unwanted.
Review Text: The food is good but not excellent and definately does not reflect the prices. This restaurant probably thrived as a tourist spot. A lot of thought and effort has been taken to create a ambience conducive to promote customer satisfaction but it failed. One would think that lighting is essential to a good restaurant rather then be a hindrance. But the lighting fails to do a basic function. That is to allow the customer to actually read the menu unless you leave your table and find enough light in some other part of the restaurant.The lighting is so low that you need a torch to read a menu. Then there is the background music that is so loud that neither my wife or myself could not have a comfortable conversation. To make matters worse the staff could not hear our orders properly. You would think that that would be enough for the staff to lower the volume. No we had to ask for the volume to turned down so we could here each other. Trying to find a beer that they had in stock became a total choir. Then to top it off one of our meals was forgotten. All in all it was not a good experience. Simple things that make a dining experience memorable were badly managed.

We loved the food at this restaurant and tasted at least 10 dishes. The decor was fun too. We were disappointed though that their specials were all out as we would have liked to try them. Service was good, but you have have to be proactive at calling waiters over if you need something. We'll be back the next time we visit HCMC.

Review Text:
Amazing tapas, i love the fois gras and grilled octopus particularly. Whenever in doubt, this is the place on top of my list to go to. i like the ambiance, chilled, relaxed. The only comment is if the restaurant chef can change the menu more often because for a regular customer, i can get tired of the same food. 
Staff are ok, service is standard, no complaint or compliment.

Review Text:
Un superbe moment comme d habitude; déjeuner un dimanche midi avec des tapas pleines de saveurs , un vin a bonne température , un service plein de charme et d humour, un prix plus que raisonnable que demander de plus pour passer un excellent weekend .A faire et a refaire sans aucune modération .
Eric et Cendy.

The restaurant is beautiful. The food is acceptable. But the service was mediocre. Especially you do not want to be served by the arrogant waiter/waitress. 
We was excited with the food so we took photos a little bit longer. But the staff just came twice and reminded us that we had to eat right away because maybe the food was not fresh so long. We knew that but they just came that was very annoyed. 
They did not smile and they treated Vietnamese customer so bad. Even the waitress knew that I’m Vietnamese but she just spoke English to me. Everyone can speak English so she doesn’t need to show off like that. So silly!!!
There is no limit to the arrogance and rudeness! When you arrive be careful that you do not like the business and the smiley staff may escape your pleasure!

Had a really nice birthday dinner here with my wife. The menu is plentisome and the food was magical and was clearly made from some great quality produce. The service and the atmosphere was special. Will be back

Review Title: Fantastic New Brunch Menu!  A Must Try For Brunch Lovers in Ho Chi Minh City!
Review Text:
Brunch is more than a meal in Saigon; it’s an integral part of life in Ho Chi Minh City. And Tomatito has crafted one of the best brunch menus around. Trust me, I’ve been nursing this delicious food baby all afternoon.

To start we had both the Sopa de Guisantes con Jamon, a beautiful green pea soup mixed with mint, courgette and Iberian ham, and the Croquetas de Espinacas, 3 spinach infused goat cheese croquettes. Clearly we were off to a good start! 

Next up we devoured the Huevos Manchegos, a piping hot skillet of crispy papas fritas topped with a colourful vegetable piperade, manchego shavings and a perfect pair of sunny side up eggs. We also sunk our teeth into the Huevos Rotos con Chorizo, which was a combination of deliciously seasoned scrambled eggs and savoury Spanish Chorizo.

For our mains, first we indulged in the Canelones. A Spanish classic of gorgeous braised beef and truffle cannelloni, garnished with sautéed mushrooms. Delicious, delectable and delightful all wrapped up and smothered in queso! Then when we tried out the Pata de Pulpo. Barbequed, tender grilled octopus accompanied by smoked potato puree, creamy aioli and crispy potatoes. Yum!

Finally for dessert, Tomatito’s Chocotrufta y Palomitas de Maíz should be at the top of everyone’s dessert bucket list. A velvety dark chocolate brownie, caramelized truffle popcorn, fluffy mascarpone mousse and rich creamy ice cream. I mean just close your eyes and let the drool flow.

Tomatito’s refreshed brunch menu combined with their classic Spanish bites we all know and love make this spot a must on any foodie’s list when in Saigon. We all know the importance of starting your weekend off on the right foot and that means brunching to your best ability. So, grab your extra-large glass of sangria and sip away those Sunday scaries!
Thực phẩm tốt và lựa chọn các loại rượu vang. Trong khoảng thời gian hai tuần, chúng tôi đã có hai bữa ăn ở đó với một nhóm bạn. Các nhân viên rất thân thiện và chu đáo. Đề nghị.

Took my family here for lunch, staff was super attentive and helpful. They provided kids meal, actually the kids loved it! We shared some tapas, calamares and marinated anchovies where super tasty. We finished with the Rib Eye which was also very delicious and presentation was spectacular on a sizzling plate. Wine list is great, really good value Spanish wine selection! Don't miss out on the Jamón, the Spanish ham served with toasted bread and tomato!

Giá trị: 4
Dịch vụ: 4
Đồ ăn: 5
Review Text:
Thức ăn: tuyệt vời, đỉnh cao. . . NHƯNG họ phục vụ tapas / canape / amuse bouche để cuối cùng bạn có thể cảm thấy rất đói sau khi trả hàng triệu vnd. Chỉ cần đặt toàn bộ menu. Mỗi một người đều tốt. Đánh giá này là dành cho Julio khi anh ấy vẫn còn là một đầu bếp ở đây, tôi tin rằng anh ấy đã chuyển sang nhà hàng khác.
Không khí: môi trường tốt cho một nhóm bạn hoặc đêm hẹn hò.
Đồ uống: đắt tiền và không ấn tượng lắm nhưng dù sao chúng tôi cũng đến đây để kiếm thức ăn.
